title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

what: Preparing proper review graphs with epmc_hits_trend()
title: Making trend graphs
text: use epmc_hits_trend() function, firstly introduced Maëlle Salmon’s blog post “make evergreen review graph”1. function takes query Europe PMC search syntax2 period years perform search arguments, returns data-frame year, total number hits (all_hits) number hits query (query_hits). default, synonym search disabled Medline/PubMed index searched.

what: Use Case: Growth of Open Access Literature
title: Making trend graphs
text: growing interest knowing proportion open access scholarly literature. Europe PMC allows searching open access content OPEN_ACCESS:Y parameter. moment, Europe PMC contains 5,641,836 open access full-texts. Let’s see relatively distributed period 2010 - 2022. plot chunk oa_pmc careful interpretation slower growth last years several ways open access content added Europe PMC including digitalization back issues.3
code: tt_oa <- europepmc::epmc_hits_trend("OPEN_ACCESS:Y", period = 2010:2022, synonym = FALSE) tt_oa #> # A tibble: 13 × 3 #>     year all_hits query_hits #>    <int>    <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1  2010   851106      78743 #>  2  2011   904847     105737 #>  3  2012   946206     140082 #>  4  2013  1004432     176617 #>  5  2014  1055201     212221 #>  6  2015  1096429     244342 #>  7  2016  1117164     273575 #>  8  2017  1138419     312877 #>  9  2018  1180115     352369 #> 10  2019  1243574     406182 #> 11  2020  1450562     585074 #> 12  2021  1550459     714651 #> 13  2022  1542959     794387 # we use ggplot2 for plotting the graph library(ggplot2) ggplot(tt_oa, aes(factor(year), query_hits / all_hits, group = 1)) +   geom_point() +   geom_line() +   xlab("Year published") +   ylab("Proportion of OA full-texts in Europe PMC")

previous_headings: Use Cases > Use Case: Cited open source software in scholarly publications
title: Making trend graphs
text: want search reference lists. Europe PMC index references complete collection, use has_reflist:y restrict search publications reference lists. literature sections can searched REF: parameter. Let’s prepare queries links mentioned code hosting services: get publications Europe PMC gives access reference lists normalizing review graph. proportion papers Europe PMC able make cited literature available 64 period 2009-2022. also seems time-lag indexing reference lists absolute number publication decreasing years. presumably Europe PMC also includes delayed open access content, .e. content added immediately original publication.4 Now, let’s make proper review graph normalizing query results number publications indexed references. plot chunk software_lit
code: dvcs <- c("code.google.com", "github.com",           "sourceforge.net", "bitbucket.org", "cran.r-project.org") # make queries including reference section dvcs_query <- paste0('REF:"', dvcs, '"') library(dplyr) my_df <- purrr::map_df(dvcs_query, function(x) {   # get number of publications with indexed reference lists   refs_hits <-     europepmc::epmc_hits_trend("has_reflist:y", period = 2009:2022, synonym = FALSE)$query_hits   # get hit count querying for code repositories   europepmc::epmc_hits_trend(x, period = 2009:2022, synonym = FALSE) %>%     dplyr::mutate(query_id = x) %>%     dplyr::mutate(refs_hits = refs_hits) %>%     dplyr::select(year, all_hits, refs_hits, query_hits, query_id) }) my_df #> # A tibble: 70 × 5 #>     year all_hits refs_hits query_hits query_id                  #>    <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>                     #>  1  2009   793210    556002         13 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  2  2010   851106    541447         40 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  3  2011   904847    604315         65 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  4  2012   946206    636843         92 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  5  2013  1004432    763720        135 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  6  2014  1055201    797730        140 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  7  2015  1096429    780777        117 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  8  2016  1117164    784272         65 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #>  9  2017  1138419    819735         52 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #> 10  2018  1180115    757852         29 "REF:\"code.google.com\"" #> # ℹ 60 more rows  ### total hits_summary <- my_df %>%   group_by(query_id) %>%   summarise(all = sum(query_hits)) %>%   arrange(desc(all)) hits_summary #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   query_id                       all #>   <chr>                        <dbl> #> 1 "REF:\"cran.r-project.org\"" 44864 #> 2 "REF:\"github.com\""         29009 #> 3 "REF:\"sourceforge.net\""     1779 #> 4 "REF:\"code.google.com\""      897 #> 5 "REF:\"bitbucket.org\""        442 library(ggplot2) ggplot(my_df, aes(factor(year), query_hits / refs_hits, group = query_id,                   color = query_id)) +   geom_line(size = 1, alpha = 0.8) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_brewer(name = "Query", palette = "Set1")+   xlab("Year published") +   ylab("Proportion of articles in Europe PMC")

title: Overview
text: Another nice feature Europe PMC search cross-references Europe PMC databases. instance, get publications cited entries Protein Data bank Europe published 2016: following sources supported CHEBI database ontology chemical entities biological interest https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi/ CHEMBL database bioactive drug-like small molecules https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chembldb/ EMBL now ENA, provides comprehensive record world’s nucleotide sequencing information https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/browser/ INTACT provides freely available, open source database system analysis tools molecular interaction data https://www.ebi.ac.uk/intact/ INTERPRO provides functional analysis proteins classifying families predicting domains important sites https://www.ebi.ac.uk/interpro/ OMIM comprehensive authoritative compendium human genes genetic phenotypes https://www.omim.org/PDB European resource collection, organisation dissemination data biological macromolecular structures https://www.ebi.ac.uk/pdbe/ UNIPROT comprehensive freely accessible resource protein sequence functional information https://www.uniprot.org/ PRIDE PRIDE Archive - proteomics data repository https://www.ebi.ac.uk/pride/archive/ retrieve metadata external database links, use europepmc_epmc_db().
code: europepmc::epmc_search('(HAS_PDB:y) AND FIRST_PDATE:2016') #> # A tibble: 100 × 28 #>    id       source pmid     pmcid  doi   title authorString journalTitle issue journalVolume #>    <chr>    <chr>  <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr>        <chr>        <chr> <chr>         #>  1 28039433 MED    28039433 PMC52… 10.1… "Str… Su HP, Rick… Proc Natl A… 3     114           #>  2 28036383 MED    28036383 PMC52… 10.1… "Str… Kovaľ T, Øs… PLoS One     12    11            #>  3 27977122 MED    27977122 <NA>   10.1… "Com… De Deurwaer… ACS Chem Ne… 5     8             #>  4 28144358 MED    28144358 PMC52… 10.3… "Bio… Ulrich V, B… Beilstein J… <NA>  12            #>  5 28028551 MED    28028551 <NA>   10.1… "Str… Zhou Z, Liu… Appl Microb… 7     101           #>  6 27958736 MED    27958736 <NA>   10.1… "Gly… Hamark C, B… J Am Chem S… 1     139           #>  7 27959534 MED    27959534 PMC66… 10.1… "Str… Reed AJ, Vy… J Am Chem S… 1     139           #>  8 27989121 MED    27989121 PMC58… 10.1… "Sho… Lin J, Pozh… Biochemistry 2     56            #>  9 27815281 MED    27815281 PMC52… 10.1… "Str… Wakamatsu T… Appl Enviro… 2     83            #> 10 28083536 MED    28083536 PMC51… 10.3… "Con… Paoletti F,… Front Mol B… <NA>  3             #> # ℹ 90 more rows #> # ℹ 18 more variables: pubYear <chr>, journalIssn <chr>, pageInfo <chr>, pubType <chr>, #> #   isOpenAccess <chr>, inEPMC <chr>, inPMC <chr>, hasPDF <chr>, hasBook <chr>, #> #   hasSuppl <chr>, citedByCount <int>, hasReferences <chr>, hasTextMinedTerms <chr>, #> #   hasDbCrossReferences <chr>, hasLabsLinks <chr>, hasTMAccessionNumbers <chr>, #> #   firstIndexDate <chr>, firstPublicationDate <chr>

text: Europe PMC gives access metadata, also full-texts. Adding (OPEN_ACCESS:y) search query, returns articles Europe PMC also fulltext. Fulltext xml document can accessed via PMID PubMed Central ID (PMCID):

europepmc::epmc_ftxt("PMC3257301") #> {xml_document} #>

what: R Interface to the Europe PubMed Central RESTful Web Service
title: R Interface to the Europe PubMed Central RESTful Web Service
text: europepmc facilitates access Europe PMC RESTful Web Service. client furthermore supports Europe PMC Annotations API retrieve text-mined concepts terms per article. Europe PMC covers life science literature gives access open access full texts. Europe PMC ingests PubMed content extends index literature patent sources. infos Europe PMC, see: https://europepmc.org/Ferguson, C., Araújo, D., Faulk, L., Gou, Y., Hamelers, ., Huang, Z., Ide-Smith, M., Levchenko, M., Marinos, N., Nambiar, R., Nassar, M., Parkin, M., Pi, X., Rahman, F., Rogers, F., Roochun, Y., Saha, S., Selim, M., Shafique, Z., … McEntyre, J. (2020). Europe PMC 2020. Nucleic Acids Research, 49(D1), D1507–D1514. https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa994.

title: R Interface to the Europe PubMed Central RESTful Web Service
text: CRAN latest development version can installed using remotes package: Loading R
code: install.packages("europepmc") require(remotes) install_github("ropensci/europepmc") library(europepmc)

title: R Interface to the Europe PubMed Central RESTful Web Service
text: search covers metadata (e.g. abstracts title) full texts. build query, please refer comprehensive guidance search Europe PMC: https://europepmc.org/help. Provide query Europe PMC search syntax epmc_search(). aware Europe PMC expands queries MeSH synonyms default. can turn behavior using synonym = FALSE parameter. default, epmc_search() returns 100 records. adjust limit, simply use limit parameter. See vignette Introducing europepmc, R interface Europe PMC RESTful API long-form documentation search Europe PMC client.
code: europepmc::epmc_search(query = '"2019-nCoV" OR "2019nCoV"') #> # A tibble: 100 × 29 #>    id        source pmid     pmcid doi   title authorString journalTitle issue journalVolume #>    <chr>     <chr>  <chr>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>        <chr>        <chr> <chr>         #>  1 36754560  MED    36754560 PMC9… 10.1… Inno… Yerlikaya S… BMJ Open     2     13            #>  2 37400836  MED    37400836 PMC1… 10.1… Effe… Ebrahimi T,… BMC Oral He… 1     23            #>  3 37223279  MED    37223279 PMC1… 10.1… Bill… Lamsal R, R… Data Brief   <NA>  48            #>  4 36727245  MED    36727245 PMC1… 10.1… Vasc… Morrissey E… JBI Evid Sy… 5     21            #>  5 37648680  MED    37648680 <NA>  10.3… [Cli… Liu ZT, Che… Zhonghua Ya… 10    59            #>  6 37211453  MED    37211453 PMC1… 10.1… Safe… Smith K, He… Vaccine      26    41            #>  7 37479685  MED    37479685 PMC1… 10.1… SuPA… Wei C, Datt… Nat Commun   1     14            #>  8 37652823  MED    37652823 <NA>  10.1… Immu… Raiser F, D… Vaccine      <NA>  <NA>          #>  9 37714559  MED    37714559 <NA>  10.1… New-… Kobayashi N… BMJ Case Rep 9     16            #> 10 PPR525786 PPR    <NA>     <NA>  10.1… The … Alihsan B, … <NA>         <NA>  <NA>          #> # ℹ 90 more rows #> # ℹ 19 more variables: pubYear <chr>, journalIssn <chr>, pageInfo <chr>, pubType <chr>, #> #   isOpenAccess <chr>, inEPMC <chr>, inPMC <chr>, hasPDF <chr>, hasBook <chr>, #> #   hasSuppl <chr>, citedByCount <int>, hasReferences <chr>, hasTextMinedTerms <chr>, #> #   hasDbCrossReferences <chr>, hasLabsLinks <chr>, hasTMAccessionNumbers <chr>, #> #   firstIndexDate <chr>, firstPublicationDate <chr>, versionNumber <int>

what: Creating proper review graphs with epmc_hits_trend()
title: R Interface to the Europe PubMed Central RESTful Web Service
text: also nice function allowing easily create review graphs like described Maëlle Salmon’s blog post: plot chunk unnamed-chunk-4 info, read vignette creating literature review graphs: https://docs.ropensci.org/europepmc/articles/evergreenreviewgraphs.html
code: tt_oa <- europepmc::epmc_hits_trend("Malaria", period = 1995:2019, synonym = FALSE) tt_oa #> # A tibble: 25 × 3 #>     year all_hits query_hits #>    <int>    <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1  1995   449216       1471 #>  2  1996   458644       1529 #>  3  1997   456804       1834 #>  4  1998   474693       1756 #>  5  1999   493837       1951 #>  6  2000   532142       2078 #>  7  2001   545702       2180 #>  8  2002   561497       2351 #>  9  2003   588612       2596 #> 10  2004   628176       2831 #> # ℹ 15 more rows # we use ggplot2 for plotting the graph library(ggplot2) ggplot(tt_oa, aes(year, query_hits / all_hits)) +    geom_point() +    geom_line() +   xlab("Year published") +    ylab("Proportion of articles on Malaria in Europe PMC")

title: Get annotations by article — epmc_annotations_by_id
text: Retrieve text-mined annotations contained abstracts open access full-text articles.

title: Get annotations by article — epmc_annotations_by_id
code: epmc_annotations_by_id(ids = NULL)

title: Get annotations by article — epmc_annotations_by_id
text: ids, character vector publication identifiers following structure "source:ext_id", e.g. `"MED:28585529"`

title: Get annotations by article — epmc_annotations_by_id
text: returns text-mined annotations tidy format following variables source Publication data source ext_id Article Identifier pmcid PMCID locates full-text Pubmed Central prefix Text snipped found annotation exact Annotated entity postfix Text snipped found annotation name Targeted entity uri Uniform link dictionary entry targeted entity id URL full-text occurence annotation type Type annotation like Chemicals section Article section mentioning annotation like Methods provider Annotation data provider subtype Sub-data provider

title: Get annotations by article — epmc_annotations_by_id
code: if (FALSE) {   annotations_by_id("MED:28585529")   # multiple ids   annotations_by_id(c("MED:28585529", "PMC:PMC1664601")) }

what: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
title: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
text: Finds works cite given publication.

title: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
code: epmc_citations(ext_id = NULL, data_src = "med", limit = 100, verbose = TRUE)

title: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
text: ext_id character, publication identifier data_src character, data source, default Pubmed/MedLine index   searched. following three letter codes represent sources   Europe PubMed Central supports: agr Agricola bibliographic database citations     agricultural literature created US National Agricultural Library     co-operators. cba Chinese Biological Abstracts ctx CiteXplore eth EthOs Theses, .e. PhD theses (British Library) hir NHS Evidence med PubMed/Medline NLM nbk Europe PMC Book metadata pat Biological Patents pmc PubMed Central limit integer, number results. default, function returns 100 records. verbose logical, print information going .

title: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
text: Metadata citing documents data.frame

title: Get citations for a given publication — epmc_citations
code: if (FALSE) { epmc_citations("PMC3166943", data_src = "pmc") epmc_citations("9338777") }

what: Retrieve external database entities referenced in a given publication — epmc_db
title: Retrieve external database entities referenced in a given publication — epmc_db
text: function returns EBI database entities referenced publication Europe PMC RESTful Web Service.

title: Retrieve external database entities referenced in a given publication — epmc_db
code: epmc_db(   ext_id = NULL,   data_src = "med",   db = NULL,   limit = 100,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Retrieve external database entities referenced in a given publication — epmc_db
text: ext_id character, publication identifier data_src character, data source, default Pubmed/MedLine index   searched. following three letter codes represent sources   Europe PubMed Central supports: agr Agricola bibliographic database citations     agricultural literature created US National Agricultural Library     co-operators. cba Chinese Biological Abstracts ctx CiteXplore eth EthOs Theses, .e. PhD theses (British Library) hir NHS Evidence med PubMed/Medline NLM nbk Europe PMC Book metadata pat Biological Patents pmc PubMed Central db character, specify database: 'ARXPR' Array Express, database functional genomics experiments 'CHEBI' database ontology chemical entities biological     interest 'CHEMBL' database bioactive drug-like small molecules 'EMBL' now ENA, provides comprehensive record world's  nucleotide sequencing information 'INTACT' provides freely available, open     source database system analysis tools molecular interaction data 'INTERPRO' provides functional analysis proteins classifying     families predicting domains important sites 'OMIM' comprehensive authoritative compendium human genes     genetic phenotypes 'PDB' European resource collection,     organisation dissemination data biological macromolecular     structures 'UNIPROT' comprehensive freely accessible     resource protein sequence functional information 'PRIDE' PRIDE Archive - proteomics data repository limit integer, number results. default, function returns 100 records. verbose logical, print information going .

title: Retrieve external database entities referenced in a given publication — epmc_db
text: Cross-references data.frame

what: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
title: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
text: main function search Europe PMC RESTful Web   Service (https://europepmc.org/RestfulWebService). fully supports   comprehensive Europe PMC query language. Simply copy & paste query   terms R. get familiar Europe PMC query syntax, check   Advanced Search Query Builder https://europepmc.org/advancesearch.

title: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
code: epmc_search(   query = NULL,   output = "parsed",   synonym = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE,   limit = 100,   sort = NULL )

title: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
text: query character, search query. information build search query, see https://europepmc.org/Help output character, kind output returned. One 'parsed', 'id_list' 'raw' default, parsed key metadata returned data.frame. 'id_list' returns list IDs sources. Use 'raw' get full metadata list. Please aware lists can become large. synonym logical, synonym search. TRUE, synonym terms MeSH terminology UniProt synonym list queried, . order replicate results website, Rest API need turn synonyms ! verbose logical, print progress bar. Activated default. limit integer, limit number records wish retrieve. default, 100 returned. sort character, relevance ranking used default. Use sort = 'cited' sorting number citations, sort = 'date' recent publications.

title: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
text: tibble

title: Search Europe PMC publication database — epmc_search
code: if (FALSE) { #Search articles for 'Gabi-Kat' my.data <- epmc_search(query='Gabi-Kat')  #Get article metadata by DOI my.data <- epmc_search(query = 'DOI:10.1007/bf00197367')  #Get article metadata by PubMed ID (PMID) my.data <- epmc_search(query = 'EXT_ID:22246381')  #Get only PLOS Genetics article with EMBL database references my.data <- epmc_search(query = 'ISSN:1553-7404 HAS_EMBL:y') #Limit search to 250 PLOS Genetics articles my.data <- epmc_search(query = 'ISSN:1553-7404', limit = 250)  # exclude MeSH synonyms in search my.data <- epmc_search(query = 'aspirin', synonym = FALSE)  # get 100 most cited atricles from PLOS ONE publsihed in 2014 epmc_search(query = '(ISSN:1932-6203) AND FIRST_PDATE:2014', sort = 'cited')  # print number of records found attr(my.data, "hit_count")  # change output  }

what: europepmc - an R client for the Europe PMC RESTful article API — europepmc
title: europepmc - an R client for the Europe PMC RESTful article API — europepmc
text: europepmc?: europepmc facilitates access Europe PMC RESTful Web Service. Europe PMC covers life science literature gives access open access full texts. Coverage restricted Europe, articles abstracts indexed world. Europe PMC ingests PubMed content extends index sources, including Agricola, bibliographic database citations agricultural literature, Biological Patents. Besides searching abstracts full text, europepmc can used retrieve reference sections citations, text-mined terms cross-links databases hosted European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI). information Europe PMC, see current paper: Ferguson, C., Araújo, D., Faulk, L., Gou, Y., Hamelers, ., Huang, Z.,  Ide-Smith, M., Levchenko, M., Marinos, N., Nambiar, R., Nassar, M., Parkin, M., Pi, X., Rahman, F., Rogers, F., Roochun, Y., Saha, S., Selim, M., Shafique, Z., … McEntyre, J. (2020). Europe PMC 2020. Nucleic Acids Research, 49(D1),  D1507–D1514. doi:10.1093/nar/gkaa994 .

title: europepmc - an R client for the Europe PMC RESTful article API — europepmc
